description: President Trump brought pomp and circumstance to his signing of the "big, beautiful bill" on Friday, with an Independence Day ceremony at the White House that included a B-2 bomber flyover.  Scott MacFarlane reports.
title: Trump signs "big, beautiful bill" as tariff deadline looms

description: Heavy rainfall in central Texas caused the Guadalupe River to overflow and unleash a torrent of water. The bodies of at least 13 children and adults have been recovered and more than 20 girls are missing from a sleepaway camp. Jason Allen reports. Meteorologist Paul Heggen breaks down how the flooding disaster unfolded.
title: Floods kill at least 13 in Texas, over 20 children missing from summer camp

description: Chester Zoo welcomed 10 penguin chicks. One chick is being raised by same-sex couple Scampi and Flounder.
title: Same-sex penguin couple raising rare chick at zoo

description: After weeks of Democratic resistance and Republican infighting, President Trump's sweeping legislation he calls the "big, beautiful bill" is now law. He signed his domestic policy plan during an Independence Day ceremony at the White House. CBS News' Aaron Navarro and Nikole Killion have the details.
title: What to know as Trump signs sweeping budget bill into law

description: President Trump officially signed his "one big, beautiful bill" domestic policy legislation. CBS News White House reporter Aaron Navarro has more from the White House.
title: Trump touts enormity of "big, beautiful bill" before signing it into law

description: President Trump signed the congressionally approved spending and tax bill into law on Friday, July 4.
title: Watch: Trump signs "big, beautiful bill" into law

description: About 20 people at Camp Mystic, an all-girls camp, are unaccounted for, Lt. Gov. Dan Patrick said during a news conference on Friday.
title: At least 13 fatalities reported in Texas as devastating floods slam Hill country

description: The following is the transcript of an interview with documentary filmmaker Ken Burns and "CBS Evening News" co-anchor John Dickerson that will air on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" on July 6, 2025.
title: Transcript: Ken Burns on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," July 6, 2025

description: The Hamas terrorist group said Friday it has issued a "positive response" to a U.S.-mediated ceasefire proposal​ in its war with Israel.
title: Hamas issues "positive response" to latest Gaza ceasefire proposal

description: Massive flooding in Central Texas has killed several people, and about 20 people from a summer camp are still missing, according to officials. CBS News correspondent Jason Allen has more.
title: Several people missing from Texas summer camp amid deadly flooding, officials say

description: Officials in central Texas say multiple people are dead after major flooding. CBS News San Antonio's Jeremy Baker reports.
title: Major flooding in central Texas kills multiple people

description: The use of prohibited chemical weapons by the Russian military had become "standardized and commonplace" in Ukraine, Dutch and German intelligence services found.
title: Dutch intel says Russia ups use of banned chemical weapons in Ukraine

description: President Trump pushed to eliminate taxes on Social Security. Does his "one big, beautiful bill" deliver?
title: Does the "big, beautiful bill" eliminate taxes on Social Security?

description: President Donald Trump says he didn't know the term "shylock" is considered antisemitic when he used it in a speech to describe unscrupulous moneylenders.
title: Trump says he didn't know term he used in speech is considered antisemitic

description: Three World War II veterans turned a simple museum cookout in Northern California into something they will never forget. CBS News Bay Area's Rick Villaroman shows why their stories made the 4th of July celebration a lot more meaningful
title: WWII veterans start new friendships during July 4th celebration

description: Fireworks, a hallmark of July 4th celebrations, are feeling the impact of President Trump's trade war with China. CBS News correspondent Ian Lee spoke to a Missouri fireworks distributor about the issue.
title: Tariffs could spell trouble for fireworks shows

description: At least one person was hospitalized, and four homes were burned during a fireworks-related fire in Los Angeles, according to the Los Angeles Fire Department. KCAL News reporter Rick Montanez reports.
title: Deadly fireworks-related explosion sets multiple homes ablaze in L.A.

description: The Hamas-run Gaza Health Ministry says hundreds of people have been killed in a month while trying to get food and medicine from a U.S. and Israeli-backed site in Gaza. New video appears to show violence at the aid distribution sites. The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation denies any wrongdoing. CBS News' Debora Patta reports.
title: American contractor reports violence at controversial Gaza aid sites

description: President Nayib Bukele, in a post on the social media platform X, wrote that Kilmar Abrego Garcia "wasn't tortured, nor did he lose weight," during his stint at a notorious El Salvador prison.
title: El Salvador president denies Kilmar Abrego Garcia's claims of abuse in prison

description: LL Cool J won't perform in the Wawa Welcome America Fourth of July Concert in Philadelphia, saying he won't "cross a picket line" amid the ongoing strike involving the city's largest municipal workers' union. CBS News Philadelphia reporter Wakisha Bailey has more.
title: LL Cool J backs out of Philadelphia concert in support of striking workers

description: New York City will host a huge Fourth of July celebration with the Macy's fireworks show. CBS News national correspondent Nikki Battiste got an inside look at how the NYPD prepares for the holiday events.
title: Inside look at how NYPD prepares for Fourth of July celebrations

description: Democratic lawmakers in Florida attempted to get into the new ICE detention facility, known as "Alligator Alcatraz," but were denied entry. They were told it was due to safety concerns. CBS Miami's Morgan Rynor reports.
title: Florida lawmakers denied entry into "Alligator Alcatraz" detention center

description: President Trump is expected to sign a bill that includes permanent tax relief for high-income earners and changes to several federal programs. Also, what the DOJ’s denaturalization push means for immigrant communities.
title: 7/05: CBS Mornings Plus

description: Documentary filmmaker Ken Burns spoke with CBS News' John Dickerson about the importance of public broadcasting and his new film on the American Revolution. More from their conversation will air on the CBS Evening News and Face the Nation.
title: Ken Burns: Attacks on PBS seem "foolhardy" and "misguided"

description: Documentary filmmaker Ken Burns spoke with CBS News' John Dickerson about his new film on the American Revolution. More from their conversation will air on the CBS Evening News and Face the Nation.
title: Ken Burns on the "complicated stories" in American history

description: Documentary filmmaker Ken Burns spoke with CBS News' John Dickerson about his new film on the American Revolution. More from their conversation will air on the CBS Evening News and Face the Nation.
title: Documentary filmmaker Ken Burns on the American Revolution: "It turned the world upside down"

description: CCTV footage released by the police showed the lion jumping a barrier, pursuing a woman, jumping on her back and knocking her to the ground
title: Escaped lion attacks woman, 2 children on busy street in Pakistan

description: As Americans celebrate the Fourth of July, climate change is another factor shaping the United States' independence. CBS Climatologist Marina Jurica discusses how it challenges your choice of where to live and its impact on farmers.
title: How climate change impacts ability to choose where you live

description: President Trump is set to sign his "big, beautiful bill" during a July 4 ceremony at the White House. The House narrowly passed the Senate version of the bill on Thursday. CBS News White House reporter Aaron Navarro discusses the reaction in Washington and more.
title: Trump is set to sign his "big, beautiful bill." Here's what lawmakers are saying.

description: Filmmaker Ken Burns says the American Revolution created a "new thing called a citizen."
title: Ken Burns on how the American Revolution "turned the world upside down"

description: Eating dozens of hot dogs in 10 minutes is not easy on the body. Experts explain what happens to the stomach.
title: What happens to your stomach in a hot dog eating contest?

description: Nearly 15,000 people were treated in emergency rooms last year for fireworks-related injuries. As Americans celebrate the Fourth of July, TNT's fireworks expert James Fuller gives tips to stay safe.
title: How to stay safe for Fourth of July celebrations amid rise in fireworks-related injuries

description: From the Clotilda to the Titanic, archaeologist James Delgado shares insights from his 50-year career.
title: The stories behind history's most haunting shipwrecks

description: An explosion at a gas station in Rome sent a huge cloud of smoke and fire into the sky shortly after 8 a.m. local time. The explosion injured dozens of people, including police officers and a firefighter. CBS News foreign correspondent Chris Livesay reports.
title: Explosion at gas station in Rome injures dozens of people

description: With the Fourth of July falling on a Friday, Americans are taking advantage of the long weekend. AAA estimates 72 million people are traveling at least 50 miles for the holiday, which is 1.7 million more than last year. CBS News correspondent Nicole Valdes reports on air travel for the holiday weekend and how gas prices are contributing to the travel rush.
title: Record-breaking travel expected for Fourth of July

description: The 2025 Nathan's Famous Hot Dog Eating Contest, a 4th of July tradition in NYC, is underway in Coney Island, Brooklyn.
title: Miki Sudo wins Nathan's Hot Dog Eating Contest women's competition

description: The explosion was heard across the Italian capital shortly after 8 a.m. local time and sent a huge cloud of dark smoke and fire that was visible from across the city.
title: Dozens injured in Rome gas station explosion: "It looked like hell"

description: A former senior Taliban official told CBS News that while the move was welcome, "Russia and China can't financially support us the way the Americans did."
title: Russia becomes first country to recognize Taliban's rule in Afghanistan

description: Ismael Abdo is one of Sweden's most wanted criminals and the subject of an international arrest warrant since 2024.
title: Notorious Swedish crime boss arrested 1,600 miles away

description: A memo directing federal attorneys to pursue more denaturalization cases has sparked anxiety in immigrant communities. Immigration attorney Kathleen Martinez joins "CBS Mornings Plus"  to break down what it could mean for naturalized citizens.
title: What a new DOJ memo could mean for naturalized U.S. citizens

description: Teresa Peroni was 27 years old when she disappeared on or around July 4, 1983, in Selma, Oregon. She was last seen with her then-boyfriend Mark Sanfratello.
title: DNA evidence leads to murder indictment 42 years after woman's disappearance

description: Entrepreneur Leigha Stepp Tingle shares how she launched Franklin and Rose with no retail experience and grew it into a multi-location boutique brand after going viral on TikTok.
title: How Leigha Stepp Tingle turned TikTok fame into a thriving boutique business

description: Renowned underwater archaeologist James Delgado joins "CBS Mornings" to discuss his new book "The Great Museum of the Sea" and reflect on his decades-long search for historic shipwrecks, including the Clotilda.
title: Explorer James Delgado shares the secrets beneath the sea

description: President Trump marked the passage of the new spending bill, which includes changes to food assistance, student loan programs, and clean energy credits. Robert Costa joins "CBS Mornings" to break down what's in the legislation.
title: Breaking down Trump's spending bill: What's in, what's out

description: Chávez was detained in front of his home in Los Angeles and will be deported to Mexico, where he faces organized crime charges, authorities said.
title: What to know about boxer Julio César Chávez Jr.'s arrest in L.A., deportation

description: Filmmaker Ken Burns explains the importance of the American Revolution, telling "CBS Evening News" co-anchor and CBS News chief political analyst John Dickerson that he thinks it's "the most important event since the birth of Christ in all of world history." Watch more of his interview Sunday on "Face the Nation."
title: Ken Burns on why the American Revolution was a "big deal in world history"

description: Millions will gather across the U.S. for the dazzling sights of fireworks to mark the Fourth of July, but the tradition relies almost exclusively on China. The Asian country makes nearly all of the fireworks that are used in the U.S. It's causing problems for fireworks retailers, many of them small businesses, because of the uncertainty of President Trump's tariffs. CBS News' Ian Lee reports.
title: How President Trump's tariffs could impact future July Fourth fireworks celebrations

description: An effort by some states to protect children from gun violence has hit roadblocks. The new laws require gun owners to lock up their firearms at home or face prosecution. However, implementing the law has presented its own set of challenges. CBS News' Scott MacFarlane reports.
title: Some states struggle to enforce laws to protect kids from gun accidents

description: From small towns to big cities, Fourth of July celebrations, including parades and fireworks, will be held across the U.S. on Friday. One of the largest annual gatherings is the Macy's fireworks event in New York City. CBS News' Nikki Battiste got a rare look at how the NYPD handles security.
title: Behind-the-scenes look at how New York City police prepares for Fourth of July celebrations

description: The government released a better-than-expected jobs report for June, suggesting the economy is resilient for now, even with the uncertainty over tariffs. CBS News MoneyWatch correspondent Kelly O'Grady breaks down the numbers.
title: June jobs report was better than expected. Here's what it means.

description: Since May, hundreds of Palestinians have been killed while trying to get food and medicine near Gaza aid sites run by the U.S.-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, according to local officials. A video filmed last month by an American contractor appears to show Americans celebrating after someone gets shot. One contractor, who spoke on condition of anonymity, described what happened to our partners at BBC News. The U.S. and Israeli-backed group has denied any wrongdoing. CBS News' Debora Patta reports.
title: Contractor says colleague fired into crowd at controversial Gaza aid site

description: According to AAA, a record 72.2 million Americans are traveling at least 50 miles from home this weekend, which is up 2.4% from last year. Almost 6 million will travel by air. CBS News' Dave Malkoff reports.
title: July 4 holiday week expected to set record for travelers

description: President Trump is set to sign his "big, beautiful bill" on Friday after the House passed the legislation in a 218-214 vote, with two Republicans joining Democrats to oppose it. House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries stalled the final passage Thursday in a record-setting speech that lasted nearly nine hours.
title: President Trump to sign "big, beautiful bill" after House narrowly passes legislation

description: President Trump prepares to sign his controversial budget bill - including permanent tax cuts for wealthier Americans. Also, it could be a record-setting holiday travel weekend. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Trump to sign controversial bill

description: Archaeologists reported finding the first "exceptionally large shoe" on May 21 and have continued to discover more since then, according to Vindolanda's website​.
title: "Unusually large" 2,000-year-old shoes unearthed by archaeologists

description: Russia hit Kyiv with its biggest aerial attacks of the war despite a call between President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin.
title: Russia pounds Kyiv with biggest aerial attacks yet despite Trump-Putin call

description: Appeals court temporarily reinstates President Trump's tariffs; Digital nomad lifestyle at odds with return-to-office mandates.
title: 5/30: CBS Morning News

description: President Trump is hosting a celebratory event at the White House to sign his "one big, beautiful bill."
title: Trump to sign "big, beautiful bill" in July Fourth ceremony at White House

description: The mission to safely guide the man to the South involved a considerable number of South Korean troops and took around 20 hours
title: North Korean eludes military, landmines to cross border into South Korea

description: Interest in the unsolved cases has surged since the televized appearance of a witness who claimed to know where bodies had been submerged in Lake Taal.
title: New twist after dozens of cockfighting participants mysteriously vanish

description: As temperatures soar this summer, are powdered products marketed as hydration multipliers worth it?
title: Hydration multipliers are everywhere. Should you use them in a heat wave?

description: A Missouri judge blocked many of its abortion restrictions, reimposing a preliminary injunction against them just a little over a month after the state's highest court had lifted a previous hold.
title: Many Missouri laws restricting abortion blocked again by state judge

description: Joey Chestnut is returning to the 2025 Nathan's Hot Dog Eating Contest. Here's how and when to watch.
title: How and when to watch Nathan's Hot Dog Eating contest for July 4, 2025

description: Dozens of cities across the U.S. will host drone shows on the Fourth of July this year, seeing them as preferable to fireworks. Here's why.
title: July 4th drone shows will light up skies in dozens of cities this year

description: Banks and post offices will close on July 4th, but many grocery stores, restaurants and other retailers plan to remain open. Here's what to know.
title: What stores and other businesses are open and closed on July 4?
